queries

Class StreamingQueries

  • java.lang.Object
    • queries.StreamingQueries

  • public class StreamingQueries
extends java.lang.Object
    StreamingQueries opens and closes new Twitter streams to fetch live tweets Tweets are stored in a List until they are requested and fetched from the servlet If a request does not occur for 60 seconds, the stream closes
    Author:
    Ben Carr & Luke Heavens Last Updated: 20/03/2014

      void addUsersAtVenueListener(java.lang.String venueName, double latitude, double longitude, double radius)

      This function adds a listener to the stream to record live tweets from a specific user
      void clearLists()
      This function clears the recorded list of tweets, ready for new tweets to be recorded

      This function updates the shutdown time and returns the stored list of tweets
      twitter4j.TwitterStream getTwitterStream()
      getTwitterStream returns the Twitter stream object
      private void incrementShutdownTimer()
      This function adds a fixed number of seconds to the current time and stores it in a variable It is used to close the stream if no requests are recieved before that time
      boolean isShutdown()
      This function checks whether the Twitter stream is shutdown or currently running

        public void addUsersAtVenueListener(java.lang.String venueName,
                           double latitude,
                           double longitude,
                           double radius)
        This function adds a listener to the stream to record live tweets in an area or about a venue
        Parameters:
        venueName - - The name of the venue to track
        latitude - - The latitude of the location to track
        longitude - - The longitude of the location to track
        radius - - The radius of the location to track
